Reviews.Title: “Very good localization and service”
Reviews.Author: Pedro_dalprat
Reviews.Content: I would like to comment this hotel, cause I found this hotel in Trip Advisor and I really liked this experience. The localization of the hotel are fantastic, you can go in 5 minutes walking to subway in the yellow line where you can find some nice places in Paris. The room size is very good for one couple. And all my question was answered by the employees. I recommend, fair price and good services.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy room”
Reviews.Author: Montysheridan
Reviews.Content: Don't stay in the attic type rooms. They have thin walls. I could hear the neighbours all night making noise. I stayed here before in the rooms on the lower floors and it was ok. But not these attic rooms. Its a cramped hotel which is common in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel, but not worth the exorbitant price”
Reviews.Author: Stanleythemanly
Reviews.Content: As we were travelling in Europe through the Christmas and New Year period, we thought that we would book our accommodation early. We booked this hotel around 2 months prior to our arrival. We thought that we would really splash out to stay somewhere special and memorable for the NY period, and this Hotel would be roughly double per night what we would spend throughout the rest of the trip. We were attracted to the hospitality of this hotel - the prospect of a welcome drink, buffet breakfast and a packed lunch. Location wise the hotel was good for us. We intended to spend NYE at the Eiffel Tower, which was only about 50min walk away. Those wishing to celebrate at the Arc or Champs Elysses had a much shorter work - only a few hundred metres. The Hotel is also very close to Argentine station. The staff were generally very kind and helpful. We had a checkout of 4.30am and this was no problem. We found the room itself to be pretty ordinary. I would put it on par with an average 3 star room. It was fairly small, the shower was fine, but not amazing, the bed was comfortable without being brilliant. The TV was limited in its selection of cable channels (notably no NT1, which has most of the English programs on French TV). The welcome drink was disappointing, a glass of mostly flat champagne. The breakfast was not very good. It was a classical French breakfast, but the food did not seem overly fresh. There were no hot food options. The 'lunch box' is a nice gesture, but again, very average. A 2eu sandwich, a bag of browning apple pieces, a bottle of water, and a packet of crisps. The bottom line is, this is an average place at a rather expensive price (even taking into account that we were there for NYE, a notoriously expensive time, I still believe this hotel is over its odds). I would suggest you take your money to Montmartre, where it will go MUCH further!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Jose_Luiz_Verta
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel B.W. Etoile Saint Ferdinand for 11 days. The hotel is excellent. The rooms are not big, but are average for a hotel of this category in a large city in Europe. On the other hand, are very clean and well maintained, as are the bathrooms. Rooms are quiet, the beds are comfortable and sleep is peaceful. The breakfast is simple but very tasty. The hotel is 5 minutes walk from two subway stations (Porte Maillot and Argentine) and 10 minutes walk from the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elyssees. It's also very quick to reach, by subway or taxi, the main tourist attractions of Paris. The hotel is 10 minutes drive from the "Boulevard Périphérique", which means it is easy to enter and leave the city without getting lost. Anyone who has been in Paris knows how important this is. :-) And less than 100 meters away there is a laundry room with very good prices, a Hertz agency, bakeries and restaurants. The staff is extremely kind and helpful. Everyone is always ready to clarify doubts and provide guidance on how to get anywhere, from restaurants to tourist attractions. Non-smoking rooms; nom-smoking hotel. I definitely would stay at this hotel on a return visit to Paris. Verta; José Luiz Rio de Janeiro - Brazil

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: Katskript
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent part of our honeymoon at this hotel in Paris November 2011. The receptionists were very kind and helpful. The rooms were small, but we didn't mind. They were clean and comfortable, and we did not spend much time in the room during the day anyways. The hotel is close to cafes. It is also close walking distance to the Arc de Triumph and the Champs Elysees although far enough so that the hotel was very quiet. My husband and I were also able to walk to the Eiffel tower, although it took us about 45 minutes or so. We enjoyed walking versus the metro so that we could see what was available in terms of stores and cafes that we would have otherwise missed. The breakfast area was crowded and we only had breakfast at the hotel one morning although it was included in our room. There are so many other quaint restaurants where you can have a warm breakfast. They served croissants, cereal, ham, and a couple other pastries. One minor issue we had was some noisy honeymooners one afternoon (if you know what I mean...lol). I suppose the rooms could have been a little quieter although I think this couple was exceptionally loud.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but a little cramped”
Reviews.Author: JHoaglandFL
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent- just a short walk between the Porte Maillot and Argentine stations. The hotel offers a small breakfast buffet (breads, cereals, ham, cheese, fruit salad), and also includes a "box lunch" of a sandwich, bagged fruit, and chips. We found this very handy when we went to Versailles: we ate the box lunch rather than spending money for lunch. The hallways and lift are a little cramped, but this is probably expected in the middle of Paris. The walls are thin: we could hear the lady in the next room talking on the phone, but luckily she was done by the time we got back from dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, quiet, clean hotel.”
Reviews.Author: legion99
Reviews.Content: We came to Paris via Eurostar for a long weekend in April 2011. Check-in was efficient with reception advising us of a free drink along with a packed lunch (we had this on our last day for the journey home). They were also willing to advise on good restaurants along with tips on how to get around. Our air-conditioned room was a decent size compared with some in Paris and was clean and tidy. There is also a lift to get to other floors but it's on the small side. Breakfast is a basic and functional affair but then you don't go to Paris to eat in a hotel! The hotel is located in a side street at the western end of the Avenue de la Grand Armee about 5/10 minutes from the Arc de Triomphe and just a couple of minutes from Porte Maillot metro station which, once your used to it is a fantastic and very cheap way to get about. All in all I'd definitely come back especially for a short get away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and lots of inclusions”
Reviews.Author: Pascoep
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights in July and of the 3 Paris properties this one had the best of everything- room fairly small but I was expecting that. Location - 10 mins walk from arc d triumph,close to Porte maillot transport links(airport bus&metro),excellent breakfast,free wiifi,welcome drinks,AND the free lunchbox- all of this saves you money .staff were lovely as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location/ service and very clean - Pity about the thin walls”
Reviews.Author: Nicolabowe
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Thursday evening - check in was very fast and the information provided at check in was very helpful. We go home about 11pm and at 3am I was woken by a door slamming and really loud voices from the room next door.The walls are paper thin they really are! Breakfast was nice not alot of choice but just enough. We had to ask for the pack lunch we were not offered it. There was only 1 towel in our room when we arrived but when we asked more were provided immediately. Get the Air France bus from Charles DeGaulle to Port Melliot and walk to the hotel it takes no more than 5 mins very handy. The whole experience was good but if you like your sleep maybe best to consider somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Herpi
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a nice location with only few min walk from 2 metro stations and about 8 - 10 min from Arc de Triomphe, rooms are very tiny as all in Paris so that didn't suprise me or bother me at all. It was clean, with the kettle and coffee/tea, bathroom was nice and modern, solid 3star hotel. Breakfast was great as well as the lunch bag which we received while checking out (sandwich, crisps, fruit and bottle of water - saved us some money for lunch). Staff at the reception were very pleasant. I would point out only 1 thing - the walls. They seem to be made of paper because we could hear all the conversations from the room next to us. Luckily we stayed during the weekday so hotel didn't seem to be very crowded and we didn't hear much noise. Just wondering if we stayed at the weekend and there would be some loud people in the neighbouring room. Probably wouldn't get much sleep. And wifi didn't work very well in our room but my dad's room which was on the other end of the corridor had a good connection.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, clean hotel, packed lunch - good value for money”
Reviews.Author: PaulandVanessaGemma
Reviews.Content: The welcome was friendly and informative. Indeed the reception staff were always extremely attentive, helpful and friendly. Other staff were also pleasant. The bedroom and bathroom was always clean. The bed was particularly comfortable and there were no creaks or squeaks. We were surprised, but pleased, to receive the packed lunch on the day we were leaving. The packed lunch is a sandwich (we had a choice of chicken, tuna or ham) fruit, packet of crisps and a bottle of water. It might sound basic but in fact it is tasty, the bread is soft and the pack is extremely useful when doing a full day of tourist type activities. The hotel is close to the Metro and the Arc de Triomphe. At first we thought the location was rather remote but we covered all the main attractions (plus more). There isn’t too much choice or atmosphere in the immediate vicinity on a night but there is the most amazing restaurant within a few hundred yards: Le Congres 80, avenue de la Grande Armee, 75017 Paris. The restaurant is superb in every respect and it is perfect for a special night. No complaints as such but the breakfast area is small and some mornings quite cramped. The air conditioning doesn’t seem too effective although if you leave it on constantly the room does cool down. We found the “bar area” quite amusing – it consists of 5 bottles of spirits on a cabinet! All things considered though, these are observations rather than complaints. The hotel offers good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: csgohan4
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for 4 nights and it came to around £100 a day. Reason I booked is the free continental breakfast, free wifi and location. Arrived at Gare de Nord via Eurostar. Easy to reach the nearest Metro station Argentine. Took less than 10 mins to walk to the hotel, the area was safe and had lots of restaurants on the way. Make sure you look at Google street to know which way to go from the Station. Check in is 2pm and we were allowed to go into our room at 2.20pm. They had an elevator so we could transport our suitcases more easily. The Room: The room was typical for Paris, it could fit two large suitcases (Max length 85cm each) +/- shopping and other small bags. However the room was clean, had a TV which is not HD, bathroom was clean and big enough for my needs, The room included two bedside tables and a medium sized desk for a computer and a kettle with coffee/ tea. These are free unlike others who charge a fortune for. They also left a 500ml bottle of water in our room which was nice. The TV had mostly French channels, for those english speaking they had BBC world news and channel 5. The bed was quite comfortable and the air con is a must given the time of the year, this kept the room nice and cool. We had a window which opened out to the street. Bathroom: As others have commented the bathtub has a glass pane which needs to be pushed in before entering, it can also lead to water on the floor. I just used one of the towels on the floor beforehand. Free Wifi: The free Wifi was very useful and meant I could use my laptop and surf the net. However don't expect fibre optic speed, the download speed maximum is around 15kb/s so you can expect the surfing won't be fast but it's fine for my needs. The continental breakfast: This was useful and saved us some money. This included either orange or grapefruit juice. Then you had a selection of baguettes, croissants chocolate versions, Salami, ham, cheese and eggs with a water boiler to do it the way you want. There is also a variety of cereal with milk. To top it off there is a choice of yogurts and a fruit bowl. There is no lunch/dinner served here, however they do give you a packed lunch which consists of a sandwich, bottle of water 500ml and packet of crisps. Make sure you ask for it at the reception. Location: Hotel close to a RER C station and Argentine on Line 1. Both useful for either reaching the centre with line 1 striaght to the Le Louvre and the RER C striaght to the Eifel Tower. It's also one stop away from RER A line which goes striaght to Disneyland. The location of this hotel is very strategic as there's no point in being close to the Gare de Nord as your using it only twice during your trip, wheras your always goining around Paris. For me mostly the west side. Cons: Our first night our next door neighbour was skyping/ talking all night which annoyed us and showed the weakness of this hotel. The walls are thin and people won't be considerate all the time, with slamming doors and talking late at night. You can try and reduce this by getting a room away from the elevator for starters, but other than that you'll have to tell the residents directly as it's more of a problem with them and the hotel aint going to make your walls thicker overnight. However the rest of the time we had a good nights sleep. Just be considerate when you come back late at night. Travellers tips: The Gare du Nord station is very poor in terms of service and efficieny with only two counters open at any one time and the subsequent huge queues as a result with mostly tourists. The automated machines there are only 3 and they don't take notes, I REPEAT they don't take notes which is so stupid compared to the London Tube. When you change money for Euros make sure you get a bag of 1-2 Euro coins or if your feeling frivolous, use your credit card and get ripped off. There are travel card equivalents whIch are charged by zones wise. For example it's better to get a Mobilis zone 1-5 if going to disneyland as it costs the same to get a return ticket anyways, so it's worth getting this as your going to travel elsewhere from Disneyland for dinner for example. Bare in mind Mobilis can only be bought from automated machines not from the unhelpful manned counters. Or you could a pack of 10 single tickets known as 'carnat' tickets which are 20% cheaper if your not travelling enough to get a Travelcard/ Mobillis. The mobilis and other tickets official website is as follows: http://www.transilien.com/web/site/accueil/guide-du-voyageur/billets-tarifs/billets-abonnements/lang/en Check for Eurostar Plus offers on restaurants and other attractions as you might save some money. Beware people flaunting goods at the Eifel tower and other well known tourist sites, their quality is likely poor and you'll get ripped off. Also beware those trying to sell you wrist bracelets at Sacre Coeur, you have been warned. Enjoy your trip and have a safe and fun trip

Reviews.Title: “Suited our needs at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: moe2468
Reviews.Content: The hotel is older and could use updating, but it was clean. The breakfast buffet offered a good variety and the bagged lunch they provided a bonus. It was about a 10 minute walk from the Arc de Triomphe and two metro stops were even closer. The staff were helpful and most spoke English. The area quiet. The room was a bit small - as expected for Paris, but we weren't in the room much, so it did not bother us, and we have stayed in smaller! Those who like furnishings to be up to date, would not enjoy this hotel. No restaurant in the hotel - breakfast area only. Liked Best - reasonable price including breakfast and bagged lunch. Free wifi in the room or use of their internet computer. Comfortable beds and quiet area. Like Least - it was hard to take a shower without flooding the floor - there was a glass panel on half the tub - so not very effective.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ParisFan_Cairo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, clean and room size adequate comapred to paris standards. bathroom is clean and all toiletries exists and very clean and spacious. Hotel staff was very friendly and smiling all the time and very helpful. Food served in a small room but ok, quantities are ok but not a lot of variety. Lunch box is served, which is ok also. Location good near to metro station and 10 to 15 min walk to arc de truimph. Free wi/fi and very good connection

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mallock20
Reviews.Content: Impeccable hotel with very helpful and friendly staff. The room was small (about 3m by 3.5m) but quite adequate, the bathroom was also small but OK for a well-placed city hotel at a reasonable price for Paris. We didn't have the free cocktail but the free lunch box was appreciated. Only a few minutes' walk from the Metro Line 1 although it is perhaps a little far from the centre for a casual tourist but dedicated ones will not be put off. We used to live in the 17th and it was good to revisit some old haunts. Our room was on the 4th floor next to the lift and on the street but there was no noise.

Reviews.Title: “"Staff Couldn't Have Been More Friendly"”
Reviews.Author: Michaelian
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel where the staff (Sylwia, Roland and Zoheir) couldn't have been more gracious and accommodating. Excellent location - short walk to the Metro Station, the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs-Elysees. Nice touch: a box lunch is prepared for guests each day!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: ED7707
Reviews.Content: Excelent hotel, great location. We were traveling with a 1 year old baby and everything was ok. Breakfast in the morning and tea lunch at the afternoon help us save some money.

Reviews.Title: “awsome moments”
Reviews.Author: SoniaGimenes
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spend some couple of week in Paris, but it was our second time, we already kwen this hotel, so we did not think twice, we returned adn I'd say cozy atmosphere, excellent location, nice welcome snack and the best part: Staff, they are very helpful and friendly!! For sure... we'll be there in our next time. Sonia/Jácomo

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: luvbug080688
Reviews.Content: Staff: The staff was amazing! They were ALL super helpful and willing to go above and beyond what was needed. If you didn't know any French, you are still fine as they are fluent in English. The staff was willing and patient to let me fumble through what French I did know. Rooms: Rooms were a bit small, but in Paris all you really need is someplace to sleep. The beds were definitely on the firm side, but not terribly bad. You can get a lock and key for the safe in your room from the front desk - just don't lose it as it will cost you 200 Euros. Bathroom: Small. Ha. And you will get the floor wet when you are showering. The glass swings both ways and it doesn't seal at all so if the shower is up too high, water will be everywhere. The first shower in it is a bit of a learning experience. Breakfast: Breakfast is your typical continental type. Croissants, bread, meats, cheeses, jams, hard boiled eggs, dates, figs, cereals, yogurt, coffee, tea, and juice. It tasted great and was the perfect way to start the day. Breakfast ran from 0700-1030 so if you didn't want to get up super early, it was okay. Lunch Box: Nice feature to take advantage of. You choose from a ham and cheese, chicken salad, or tuna sandwich and then get a bag of chips/crisps, sliced apples, and a bottle of water. Very nice touch! Location: Right behind the Arc de Triomphe about 1/4 mile on the main street. Easy to find. Overall, it was a great place to stay and would definitely recommend it to anyone who needed someplace to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Kone7-11
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, we were treated very well. Sylwia was extremely helpful and knowledgable. All of the staff were kind and accommodating. The breakfast buffet was great--pastries, breads, meats & cheeses, hard boiled eggs, cereal, yogurt, etc. We requested the free "lunch pack" every day after breakfast to eat later on the bus or in one of the many beautiful Parisian parks. Our room was on the 5th floor and was just fine, though my husband thought the mattress was too hard, we slept well anyway. No outside noise except for the garbage trucks in the morning. The walls are a little thin, but it was okay. The elevator is the tiniest we have ever seen! Very good location next to the metro Porte Mailot and only a 10-minute walk to The Triumph Arc and Champs Elysees. We took a comfortable shuttle bus (20Euro) from the CDG airport and it dropped us off only a block from the hotel. This information I received from Sylwia in an email when I confirmed our reservation. We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: MBRECED
Reviews.Content: We were traveling on our own, but planned to meet up with some friends who were in a tour group staying at the Meridien. So, I started my hotel search around the Porte Maillot area, and came up with the BW. We were very happy with our choice. As other reviewers have said, breakfast and boxed lunch was included, which was a big convenience and money saver. We were lucky and got a large sized room, with king bed and double vanity in the bathroom. Our view was nonexistent, but at least we were comfortable! The staff was so cordial, friendly and helpful -- I can't say enough about them. We took the Air France bus from CDG to Porte Maillot, and that was so easy. Having the Metro/RER right there too, made sightseeing that much easier. We got pretty good at navigating the city at the end of our stay -- now we just need to go back! Loved Paris!!

Reviews.Title: “Loation, location, location (and good service!)”
Reviews.Author: roeslers
Reviews.Content: There is a whole lot to like about this hotel! It is small and relatively no-frills, but clean and attractive (in a "seen better days" way) nonetheless. You get free breakfast AND a complimentary bag lunch on request! (The bag lunch consists of apple slices, chips/crisps, a bottle of water, and a ham + cheese sandwich---a 6 Euro value alone.) In the room I had, everything was small and compact, but had enough room to move around with one large bag. If there had been a second person in the room, we would have been stumbling over each other. There is a small built-in armoire for clothing and luggage storage. The safe in my room was broken/non-functional. (I got a rate of 134 Euro at booking.com, so I imagine I was assigned the smallest possible room....but still got free breakfast and lunch bag!) Nonetheless, there was very little noise from adjoining rooms. The bathroom was EXTREMELY tiny but very clean and perfectly adequate for my needs: there was plenty of hot water, nice soap, and all the shower fixtures seem new and worked flawlessly. The FREE wifi worked very well. The hotel is on a quiet side street so sleep quality is good; beds and pillows are of average comfort. There are many nice restaurants within a very easy stroll. Most importantly, it is an easy walk to several different metro lines and the Arc d'Triomphe. They offer a free drink in the cozy lobby (meaning beer, wine, juices) on arrival. All desk personnel spoke excellent English and were extremely helpful. The one elevator is absolutely miniscule; fits one person and luggage or two people (claims to fit 4). There was no trouser press or other method for pressing clothes; laundry services are expensive (like 5 Euro to wash a pair of ladies' panties). Breakfast is very minimal continental, consisting only of cereals, bread or croissants, coffee, juices, yogurt and some dried fruits. I travel extensively: this is a great basic, clean, comfy, but small hotel for budget travelers. Highly recommend for the leisure traveler, but not for those requiring business support. I would stay here again for leisure, but for business only if other more attractive alternatives were not available. Caution: The glass shower door swings both in and out. Best to swing it in to enter the shower, then reposition it, but MAKE SURE you have it OVER the bathtub. Otherwise the water runs down it and leaks all over the floor---something I learned the hard way!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly service & clean room :)”
Reviews.Author: ShereeseT
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights during my Christmas vacation. Have evaluated different hotels/ hostel before my booking. It's definitely a great hotel for budgeted travel, the hotel is located near the city center, 5-minute walk to the Metro station Argentine, and near the RER station. French neighborhood which you can easy to find French restaurants, supermarkets nearby. Right at Champs-Elysees when I walked out from the hotel. Pretty safe even coming back at night, not difficult to find the hotel for my first visit (P.S. I use google map street view before my visit, make sure I get the right way). Friendly and helpful staff, when I asked about the recommendation of French restaurant nearby or other inquiries; Greeting at the morning or when we came back at night. Breakfast - place is a bit "tiny" but can serve about 20+ people, only one lady help preparing seems to be busy. Overall satisfied wif the breakfast variety - basic things like bread, ham & cheese, coffee, fruit and yogurt. when compared to my stay of my Europe Trip, already the best breakfast (compared to other hostels)! Room is clean, decent, quite new, comfortable bed! Have tea cups and instant coffee. Bathroom is clean as well:) so everything in the room is fine and I am satisfied with! Can see the blue sky and the neighborhood when I opened the window! Lunch box provided free for charge do help - it simply includes a sandwich, package of fruit, chips and the bottle of water! Help to save some money!

Reviews.Title: “Fine”
Reviews.Author: UKMPH
Reviews.Content: I was staying here for one night on a trip to Paris. For reference I was in room 105 The room was fine - the bed was comfortable. As with most rooms in Paris it wasn't huge - although the bathroom was laughably small. The room was so tiny that the door couldn't actually open fully. As a result - anyone of larger proportions would have struggled to get through the door to use the toilet or the bath. The other problem with the room was the heating which was stuck on the Sahara setting - but given I arrived at 11:30pm - I was too tired to really fuss - 10 minutes with the window open brought the temperature down to acceptable. The breakfast was fine and the service from the staff was fine for the time I was there. Location wise - it was perfect for me. You are close to the metro. Would I stay again? yes.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay, fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: protonriver
Reviews.Content: We were a little apprehensive when we first saw the narrow corridors and elevator, but the room itself was fine- well-equipped, clean and with a large window both to faciliate ventilation but also giving a good view of the picturesque rue St Ferdinand. The staff are extremely friendly, polite and are bilingual (and do not express any irritation in having to deal with people like us who don't even make an effort in French). The hotel also offers value for money with its free welcome drinks, continental breakfast (which can also be ordered to be delivered in bed, which we did) and a lunch box. In terms of location, it is located close to the Arc de Triumph, however, the main benefit we felt was its proximity to the Metro which has direct connections to the Champ-Elysees, Bastille, Charles de Gaulle airport, the Louvre and major connecting points such as Chatelet. The one downside of the area (for us) was that it was on the quiet side. The street itself has a couple of restaurants, but not much hustle and bustle.

Reviews.Title: “FAB WEEKEND IN PARIS”
Reviews.Author: desdan42
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very handy for all the main attractions but is situated in a fairly quiet area. The best thing about thishotel are the staff, who are a credit to it. Nothing was too much trouble for any of them. The complimentary drinks are free lunch boxes are a nice touch too. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem behind the Arc de Triomphe”
Reviews.Author: thatdutchguy
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for price/location ratio and it's well worth it. Perfect location 5 min walk away from the Champs Elysees and 2 Metro stops (line 1). Small but well equipped rooms boutique style. Breakfast (croissant OJ fresh eggs etc continental style) included, water bottle, lunch bag. Great staff in fluent english. Supermarket 1 street away several good restaurants and bistros 1 street away. Parking discounted by hotel (rue Brunel).Seen 4 star hotels with less quality. Free wifi as well. Will come again! PS one note: when the hotel is booked the capacity of the breakfast room isnt up to par. Maybe asking guests for a timeslot will solve that?

Reviews.Title: “Fab little hotel”
Reviews.Author: billyblake
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a great stay at the Etoile Saint Ferdinand hotel. There were 12 girls on a Hen Do weekend. The staff couldn't have been more helpful especially as one of us lost her passport. The staff organized a bus to the airport for a good rate 10 euro's each instead of taxi prices 15 euro's. The hotel was a good base to explore Paris. Lots of Bars and restaurants next to the hotel. The packed lunch was brill. Breakfast was a bit of a squeeze, not very much room. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone and may even return with my hubby.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST Hotel i have stayed at....”
Reviews.Author: Tony408
Reviews.Content: The position , the clean rooms , the breakfast , the complimentry lunch pack where all FANTASTIC. The Reception staff where the best I have ever come across, they could not be more helpful to us. After our appartment fell through (forget appartments in Paris) we needed some where quick for our family to stay over the New year week. They where so accomodating... Definatly be back ...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, great service”
Reviews.Author: travelador
Reviews.Content: The hotel's rates may seem high but they include everything: breakfast, lunch box, wifi, aperitif ... and when you know the prices in the 17th arrondissement of Paris, you are really happy they are including this for you! Rooms are standard Paris size but the bathrooms are spacious and new and service is attentive. Great stay and great value for the money in one of the most exclusive neighborhoods of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay if you like france”
Reviews.Author: pimlatu
Reviews.Content: stayed here 3 nights, with 5 year old daughter, no problem! easy to find hotel from air france bus stop porte maillot, nice clean room, nice bathroom , good chair to spend evenings in while my daughter is sleeping, and the internet is working and stable, which i really appreciate. breakfast was nice, more than enough to choose from, smiling breakfastlady, competent people at the reception. the area is probably higher middle class, som nice restos and stores, and you are just a few steps away from bigger noisier shopping streets. due to the greve going on, we went by foot, took us half an hour to the tour eiffel, not bad. french neighbourhood, not the usual tourism traps. nice introduction to paris for my daughter!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly great”
Reviews.Author: doubleAtravels
Reviews.Content: In general, Paris hotels have learned the art of the "spin" ... and many a trip have we been disappointed, although not surprised, to find that the reality is a little less cute,quaint, clean and convenient than the online version. This hotel, however, does not disappoint. In fact, it lives up as to exactly what it says. It goes way over what you would expect on the the service end. Staff were exceedingly pleasant and willing to help. Rooms are modest but comfortable and quiet. Breakfast has a decent spread. Neighborhood is beautiful. Local restaurants delish (special favorite is La Villa Corse for Corsican food). All is all, this hotel makes for a great stay and an affordable one to boot. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “A great boutique hotel with excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: Yarra1
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its proximity to the Palais des Congres. It is 5 minutes walk to the convention center and also only 5 minutes to 2 Metro stations which get you into the center of Paris in 10 minutes. The staff were friendly, the breakfast great and to top things off you get a free packed lunch every day to take with you when you head off sightseeing. The room (deluxe) was spotlessly clean, (cozy size as you expect in Europe) with a refurbished beautiful bathroom. The hotel management were very helpful and patient. We would recommend this hotel to anyone..good value for money too!

Reviews.Title: “Great little place!”
Reviews.Author: sherlockwife
Reviews.Content: Just back from weekend trip to Paris. Hotel is very clean. Staff were friendly (and they spoke better English than we do!) Room clean. Bathroom very clean and modern. Beds not that comfortable (we had two twin beds) but clean sheets and blankets. Breakfast room is small and food is typical European continental - lovely. Use of computer in lobby and they also provide a box lunch if you request it in the morning. Includes a sandwich, water, an apple and a bag of chips. (FOR FREE!!!) Excellent location and close to two metro stations and RER line to airport!!

Reviews.Title: “a hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: pye72
Reviews.Content: just back from our stay in paris. a lovely hotel- with metro porte maillot and RER minutes away. around the hotel are several lovely restaurants- bistro st ferdinand, 3 courses meal 38 Euros is a bargain! top quality food and service. La maison equally lush. we were recommended Le relais de vignes had massive queues every night so didnt get to try it out. hotel is walking distance to all the sites,if you are that way inclined and we were. so we walked to l'arc de triomphe, to le tour effiel, jardins de tuilleirres and musee d'orsay. now to the hotel- great welcome by 'sylwia' who was always on hand to help in a very professional, sweet way. osman was on duty in the evenings, a great bubbly character who loves to talk philosophy and history and handed out kir royales as the welcome drink as well as the every night drink! the breakfasts were good but very busy, not a very big or practical room. our bedroom was a superior and was a great size with a massive bathroom. my only negatives about the stay were the pillows and the stuffiness of the room. as a asthmatic i cant use feather pillows. we made this clear on booking but the room still had them. we phoned reception to be told they were not feather. i had a very bad nights sleep( due to the slamming doors also) and eventually saw they were feather! we informed the managed who apologised and told housekeeping to change them. they were changed but were still feathers! the third time they were correctly changed. the room needed airing every day, it was incredibly stuffy, i wouldnt stay in room 104! other than that it was perfect! the 3 star hotel with 5 star staff!

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: supertramp33
Reviews.Content: just spent 4 nights at a great little hotel ten minutes walk from arc de triomphe and lovely welcome from nice staff recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: PjChes
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three days with teenage grandson. Warmly welcomed on arrival by reception staff. All staff met could converse in English and were extremely helpful. Room and bathroom rather on small side. No drawers in furniture for storing clothes. However, beds were comfortable and room was clean. Air conditioning very good and kept room cool. Breakfast room a little cramped bur a good and varied selection of breakfast items on offer (but dont expect bacon & eggs!!) An excellant position for visiting Paris. A minutes walk from Port Maillot metro & RER stations. Metro is line 1 which within minutes passes through the centre of Paris and has connections with all the other metro lines. Just a five minute walk to the Arc de Triumph & Champs Elysee. Port Maillot has a good selection of cafes & restaurants all within easy walking distance of the hotel. Even though I have a few criticisms of the room, overall location & price it was a bargain find.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Giantmouse
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel at very short notice as the one we had booked was flooded. Our room was comfortable and quiet resulting in excellent sleep quality. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and the breakfast which was included, more than adequate. The location is very handy to restaurants and cafes as well as the Metro. A very pleasant experience indeed ...... we will be back !

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, clean, friendly staff; rooms cud hv been bigger, b'fast has scope for improvement”
Reviews.Author: abhishek15
Reviews.Content: Excellant location- close to good restaurants, subway and dep stores Clean and well kept rooms; but cud have been bigger (unlikely in Paris though) Room ws cramped with child's bed. B'fast spread could have been better with some hot stuff

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect for visiting Paris”
Reviews.Author: VAEN
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, I'd recommend the superior double room, it's a little bit larger than the standard one. The hotel is quite as it's located on a secondary street with a few traffic but very close to the Porte Maillot subway station where you can find also RER station ( very easy access to Versailles by RER). The personnel was very helpful and friendly. They clean our room every day. The breakfast was good and varied. We enjoyed our staying in this hotel which is just perfect for visiting Paris, being so close to the main touristic places.

Reviews.Title: “Thank You”
Reviews.Author: KeynshamBristol
Reviews.Content: Briliant time thanks to the staff who went out of their way to help us in the recent volcano ash delays. The were firendly helpful and a great sense of humour .. what crisis? Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Tedlooney
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent little hotel with a warm and friendly atmosphere. The staff were great and very helpful. The price included continental breakfast, a packed lunch, a welcome drink, toiletries, wifi etc, and for those who didn't bring a laptop there was a PC near reception with free internet access. The room was fine, ours looked a little dated but other rooms on our floor were in the process of being refurbished so I guess our room was next on the list. The bed was very comfy and there was an LCD TV. The bathroom had a bath with shower and towels were changed daily. The room and public areas were very clean. The breakfast room was quite small and some people had to wait for a table but this seemed a minor problem. The hotel location is great, a few minutes walk to the Arc de Triomphe and there are a couple of metro stations close by. There is a mini market down the street and some really good restaurants within walking distance, indeed, just a couple of doors down at the Restaurant St Ferdinand we had a fantastic meal. We took the Air France bus from Paris CDG which took us directly to the nearby Porte Maillot, a few minutes walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel- Great find!!”
Reviews.Author: Cared200
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great little find! Smallish rooms, but apparently a decent size for Paris, kept immaculately clean, by the friendly and extremely helpful staff. A substantial continental buffet breakfast is included in the hotel price, with a daily packed lunch if required.....a bonus....Paris is quite expensive!! You can also request a complimentary "Tea Tray- kettle, cups, t-bags...buy your milk from the nearby shop! We will be returning to Paris, as we did not have enough time to do all we wanted to do, and wil certainly return to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice Service, Excellent Location, Great Service - A Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: jwiandt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is now on my permanent list of good hotels. In Paris it's hard to find a decent hotel at a reasonable price, and this place definitely fits the bill. VERY friendly service, lots of extra amenities, and a surprising large and tidy room. this was a real pleasure and made the Paris leg of my trip nicer. The ONLY downside was a plastic cover under the sheets of the bed, which made me feel a bit like I was either in a nursury or a house of ill-repute. But I would recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for central Paris location”
Reviews.Author: AmbroseB
Reviews.Content: Stayed one nigh on business. Business economies mean I'm looking at Best Western rather than Le Meridien! Pleasantly surprised. Efficient check-in, very nice, simple room. I was offered a glass of wine on arrival, and when I checked out the following morning I was offered a lunch box (declined - I was off to CDG) and a bottle of water. There is no restaurant or bar - this is a small hotel - but it's centrally located so there are plenty of options within a short walk. The hotel does have a small breakfast room that serves a simple, typically French breakfast - perfectly adequate. What surprised me most was the price I paid - under €100 including breakfast, which, in my experience, is exceptionally good for a Paris hotel in a prime area.

Reviews.Title: “overbooked - terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: busybee2009
Reviews.Content: I travelled alone to Paris earlier this month on a business trip; attending a conference in palais Congres. Booked a single room at the St Ferdinand for one night, confirmed by email; arrived at the hotel during our lunch break (the hotel is a few min walk from the Palais Congres which is why I booked it) only to be informed by the very condescending and unhelpful manager that they had overbooked and I could not stay there!! His poor attitude continued and he just stated (no apologies offered even tho' he could see I was clearly upset by then) that my booking was transferred to a "similar class hotel only a 5 min walk away". Even when I informed him that I was travelling alone, spoke no French and had to return to attend the rest of the conference and could not just go about searching for hotels; he could only shrug!!! Finally, after about 10 min of more upsetting discussion, I was forced to accept a transfer to the BW regent's garden - a good 10 min further walk (defeating the whole purpose of my booking with BW). Cannot comment on any of the facilities but if you are considering booking this place then please ensure you have some other alternatives as backup!!!

Reviews.Title: “Surprised at value vs cost; in a good way!”
Reviews.Author: ykbuffalo
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell; Paris ain't cheap. In fact it is damn expensive. But the hotels are a deal - if you look; and this one offers breakfast, a staff that is multi-lingual and a tea kettle (!). Wonderful. Great location and I can not say enough about it. First time in France; stayed for a week and loved both Paris and this hotel. I will return to both. Very highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic hotel close to all the romance of Paris!”
Reviews.Author: aztravelcritic
Reviews.Content: What a great little hotel! I say little because it is typical Paris/European small (elevator has a max person capacity of 4!). But who cares? Our room was clean and well decorated. The photos on this site are very accurate to the room we stayed in. Our room was light, airy, bright and romantic. Our room overlooked the street which was quiet at night. The hotel staff was VERY friendly. They appreciated my butchered attempts at speaking French and were very helpful with restaurants and travel. One night we were looking for a restraunt. The staff went onto the internet and searched things out for me, even providing a map. When it came time to check out, the clerk advised us the train workers were on strike and we needed to make other arraingments to get to the airport. The location of the hotel could not be better for us. 10 minute walk to the Arc de Triumph and Champs Elysee. It was only a 5 minute walk from the metro stop Porte Maillot. Very convienant. The price was a little higher than I would have wanted, but considering the location, it was fantastic. At it was much lower than other hotels in the same area. They offer a full breakfast, but we did not eat it as the price was very high, almost $20 per person. Would I stay there again? You bet. It will be the first place I look when I go back to Paris. P.S. This was the second trip for me to Paris. Parisians as a whole were much friendlier this time than they were 10 years ago.

Reviews.Title: “Unpleaseant experience”
Reviews.Author: Member015
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, I have just had an unpleasant experience with this hotel. Having stayed here twice before, I was happy with the hotel in terms of its standard of accomodation and location. However, we ended up cancelling our stay in September 2008. The cancellation was processed through the correct channels well in advance. I was surprised when we were charged for the stay on my credit card and rang the central reservations line to enquire. Immediately, I was informed that it was an error on the part of the hotel and that it would be refunded. A simple refund to my credit card would be expected. However, a saga ensued whereby I had to send my bank account details to receive a transfer and it took over 3 weeks for the refund to be processed. The hotel manager would not interact directly with me, only through the central customer service department and I did not receive an apology for the inconveniece caused. The manager came across as rude and arrogant and I will not be returning to this property in future as a result of this experience. In fact, I would think twice before booking with Best Western in general again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, compact hotel”
Reviews.Author: thecaribou
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Best Western Etoile Saint-Ferdinand in November 2007. We loved the hotel and the staff. It is at a very walkable distance from the shuttle bus stop from the airport (Porte Maillot stop). The rooms are small but comfortable (especially for a couple) . The staff were friendly and helpful. We were there when the rail strikes hit France, and Slyvia from the frontdesk made a real effort to help us get information on trains running. They also kept our excess luggage that we didn't want to lug around on the rest of the trip around Europe, and collected it when we got back to Paris. It is very conviniently located, at a walkable distance to the Arc de Triumph and Champs Elysees. There are two good bakeries around the square when you step to the left on stepping out of the hotel. There is also a convinience store located adjacent to the hotel, convinient for buying water and other nick knacks. The only draw back I could mention is that the elevators are really small and could take a couple of trips if you have lots of luggage. We were very happy with our choice of hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Another double booking?”
Reviews.Author: DeeDeeEngland
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for the rugby world cup final weekend and duly received email confirmation directly from the hotel. All travel arrangements had been made when we received another mail from the hotel to say a mistake had occurred and the hotel was actually closed on the dates we had booked. We called central Best Western and, as suspected, the hotel was indeed open (why would it be closed on the busiest weekend of the decade?). After several frantic emails to the hotel and to the booking website, the hotel eventually called to say they could offer another hotel outside Paris city centre. Clearly this was not an acceptable alternative to a hotel by the Arc De Triomphe! As this was only 4 days before the rugby final we were unable to book another hotel and had to cancel our Paris plans. We would not recommend this hotel and , in future, will not book another hotel with the Best Western branding.

Reviews.Title: “Poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Chicago01
Reviews.Content: We have just spent three days in this hotel and overall it was O.K., however our breakfast experience was very poor. Especially considering that the breakfast is not included and they charge 13.00 Euros for it . One of the mornings we had to wait for 40 minutes because they did not have clean dishes and when they finally got them there was nothing to eat at the buffet. We had to wait for another 20 minutes for them to refill the buffet. We could get much better breakfast outside of this hotel and quicker too! A TripAdvisor Member. Chicago, IL , USA

Reviews.Title: “Little gem”
Reviews.Author: JocelynNI
Reviews.Content: Just arrived home from a very enjoyable stay in Paris. We spent 4 nights at the Saint Ferdinand Hotel and were most impressed on all aspects of this boutique hotel. Location wise the hotel is several minutes from the Arc de Triomphe and the Champs Elysees. The staff were extremely helpful and advised on eateries and local amenities. The room we stayed in had obviously just been decorated and was done so very tastefully. There are some very nice restaurants near the hotel, especially 'La Relais de Venise'-well worth a visit if you enjoy steak. Overall, a very pleasant hotel in a super location, wouldn't hesitate to return when next in Paris.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Etoile Saint-Ferdinand
HotelInfo.Address: 36, rue Saint Ferdinand | 17th Arr., 75017 Paris, France
